Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2015 03:10PM Lmcqueen wrote: kmntwins - I have been able to wear the Playtex Flex which I purchase at Target and it works pretty good.  The only problem I have is that my nipples show through but haven't found anything to help with that as of yet.  Tried the gel petals and you just see the round top with the nipple coming through and also tried nursing pads but you see the nursing pads and nipples...sigh... http://www.target.com/p/playtex-women-s-play-it-up-downtimer-bra-m410/-/A-15724080#prodSlot=medium_1_1&term=playtex+flex+bra
Posts.Title: December 2014 Surgery Sisters knmtwins Scottiemom11

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2015 03:16PM Lmcqueen wrote: @chloesmom - I just started getting fills a couple of weeks ago from my new PS.  I am now at 680cc's.  The first fill was quite painful as my TE's aren't placed right and they had to stick me at least 5 times on the right side.  So they added 120cc's.  Needless to say it was a tough week after that.  The last time I went in they only added 60cc's but it was a much easier fill.  I was supposed to go back last week but decided to take a week in between.  She plans on expanding me to 860 cc's and then doing my exchange 3 months later to 800cc implants.
Posts.Title: December 2014 Surgery Sisters knmtwins Scottiemom11

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2015 05:36PM Lmcqueen wrote: gingercake, I have had problems with dry eyes as well but not from chemo. They inserted the stents in my ducts and it did help. However, they will fall out on their own if you rub your eyes. I would definitely try the Systane. I still have to use it mostly just at night but if your ducts are closed that might be the best course for you if insurance will cover it. I hope it gets better soon.
